isis.stitle: DT/DTI-466 A and B Series DT/DTI/DTA-466 C Diesel Engine Diagnostics (1993) - DIAGNOSTIC ANALYSIS - DIAGNOSTIC ANALYSIS PROCEDURES FOR.. - ...COOLANT IN LUBRICATING OIL OR LUBRICATING OIL IN COOLANT.

svcproc.title: ...COOLANT IN LUBRICATING OIL OR LUBRICATING OIL IN COOLANT.

item.para: Cracked or porous cylinder head - top deck, core plug area or blown head gasket.
Injection nozzle sleeve area - top deck area.
Porous crankcase - in area of main bearing crankcase webbing.
Lower cylinder sleeve "O" ring area. [Damaged or eroded.]
Cracked or porous power cylinder sleeve.
Lube oil cooler. [Cracked or loose tubes.]

step2.para: Drain all lube oil and coolant from engine and radiator.
Disconnect the radiator from the engine and cap off all the engine connections (with hose clamps and plugs).
Disconnect the unit's cab heater connections at the engine and cap engine openings.
Disconnect air compressor coolant supply and discharge line then cap lines at engine.
Disconnect and remove air discharge pipe from turbocharger to the engine mounted intercooler [if equipped].
Disconnect intercooler coolant supply and discharge lines at the engine [if equipped].
Disconnect and leave open oil supply return line to crankcase from air compressor (if equipped).
Remove the valve cover, lube oil pan and oil drain plug from the lube oil cooler.

caution.para: DO NOT LOOSEN OR REMOVE ANY INJECTION NOZZLES FROM THE CYLINDER HEAD WHILE THE COOLING SYSTEM IS UNDER PRESSURE.

step2.para: Fill the engine with water and attach an air line connection coupled with a regulator assembly to the water drain in cylinder block.

Pressurize the crankcase cooling system to 30 psi. Pressure must be maintained until leakage location is evident. It may be necessary for the engine to remain pressurized over night to locate porous castings or tiny cracks.
It is essential that all points of leakage identified prior to teardown and repair. NO EXTERNAL OR INTERNAL LEAKAGE IS ALLOWABLE.

note.para: On water cooled engines, pressure test the intercooler separately after complete engine pressure test. Cracked or loose tubes in the intercooler may cause coolant to leak into the intake manifold and eventually into the cylinders.

step1.para: When the location of the leak is found and repaired, clean the contaminated engine using Butyl Cellosolve or Butyl jaysolve as directed.
